awd_titl_txt: Jaime Escalante Math and Science Program
awd_abstract_narration: This project expands the highly successful East Los Angeles                     College/Garfield High School Advanced Placement Calcumlus Program to            include additional mathematics programs, and teacher enhancement                programs for teachers of physics, chemistry, and computer science.  In          all, twenty-seven K-12 teachers will be instructed in the course                design methods and teaching techniques of acclaimed master teacher              Jaime Escalante.                                                                                                                                                The project continues the efforts in motivating inner-city minority             students towards serious involvement with mathematics and science.              The program will be for three years, and, in addition to the teachers,          will involve approximately 400 students.                                                                                                                        East Los Angeles College and the ARCO Foundation are providing cost-            sharing equal to 204% of the NSF funding.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
